Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Pataikos
Description: This small figurine in faience takes the form of an infant  dwarf. Also called Pataikos, a designation given by Herodotus, this divinity is characterised by his apotropaic function.  He was thus associated with the gods Bes, Harpocrates and Ptah. The reverse of the amulet is provided with a hole for suspension.
